content.description: A wild variation finish to The Great White Roof. Climb The Great White Roof until you are under the roof. Finish out directly over the roof and make a hard exciting mantle to the top with your last gear in the crack below the roof.

At the far right end of the crag start at a large oak tree and small cave. Climb up the cracks and ledges to a roof. Make the crux moves over the roof to a ledge. Finish up the final V-Groove to the tree above.
Climb a thin flake with a bolt to a small roof. Clip the second bolt and make the crux moves over the roof on thin holds. Climb easier terrain past 2 more bolts to ring anchors.
Climb the flake on the left end of the cliff. Pull over a small roof and continue up the face on big holds. The top has a new bolt anchor.

This route climbs the main buttress up the tallest part of the cliff. Climb up an easy slab to lone bolt. Continue up the slab with thin moves to gain a horizontal with a gear placement. Make moves up to a big flake and clip a bolt. Make the crux moves up to a jug and clip the third bolt. Make a hard mantle move to gain a ledge. Take a rest and then follow the arete past horizontals with gear to ring anchors at the top.

Start 15' right of Black Mamba at a pocket. Climb up the slab placing gear past 2 bolts to an overlap. Pull the overlap using a big flake and continue up the face placing gear in horizontals to a ring anchor with a nice view!

Climb up a small corner/flake to a high first bolt. At the second bolt traverse right along a shelf. Make a move up to another shelf and clip the third bolt. Climb through the crux to a horizontal that takes gear. Continue up the excellent face past a bolt to ring anchors just out of site over the bulge.

Another roof system halfway up the cliff. Climb up the first part of Knights in White Spandex past 2 bolts and then traverse right over to the tree ledge (belay). Climb the big flake roof crack up and right and then continue up to trees at the top.

Start at a small dead tree at the base. Climb up flakes and dykes past three bolts to a ledge below the roof. Climb up the crack and clip a fixed cord on a chockstone. Follow the fist to hand crack right under the roof and top out when the roof ends.
content.protection: gear to #3 or #4, 3 bolts, trees for anchor.

content.description: Can you find the source of the name? Start the same as Chicken Leg Landry. Climb up the wide crack to the first ledge and then step left and undercling out to the high first bolt. Make the crux moves over the small overlap onto a small shelf and clip the second bolt. The blocks dirctly above the bolts look very suspect and I would recommend staying away from them. Climb up and left into an alcove and follow a small crack to the tree above.
content.protection: 2 bolts, normal rack, tree for rap

content.description: Stick clip a high first bolt at the dyke route. Climb up the dyke to the bolt then trend right onto the face and continue past 2 more bolts to a horizontal that takes gear. Finish up easier terrain placing gear to trees above.
Climb a nasty dyke up to a crack. Follow the crack and finish up blocky terrain to the top.

This climbs the jutting arete to the left of Dogs of War. It's possible to make it all independent by staying just left of Dogs' start. Then at a stance continue straight up the arete (crux) to the top.
content.protection: At this point I'd TR it off of trad anchor or tree.
content.location: This is near the right side of the cliff. Just to the right of Chicken Leg Landry and just left of Dogs of War. Rap off trees or walk off

content.description: A nice thin face climb. Climb easier terrain to the halfway horizontal placing gear on the way. Get some good gear in the horizontal and then pull onto the final steep headwall. Place gear in shallow horizontal to and anchor at the top.
Decent climbing that's a little bit clean but not really. Kind of good for a chimney I guess
content.protection: Normal rack, top out to trees
content.location: This is probably the last line on the right side of the cliff. Right behind a large tree to the right of Rigamorits

content.description: Start at the big chimney/off-width. Climb the series of ledges and cracks trending right. At a small tree ledge finish up the final off-width corner to trees above.

Climb the black water stained streak (often wet) past 3 black bolts. Pull onto a ledge with optional gear. Climb up to the forth black bolt. Continue up with more gear in horizontals to a ring anchor.
content.protection: mid sized cams, bolts, ring anchor   well protected

pathTokens: New Durham Area  (Longstack, Devil's Den, Rines Hill, etc.)

content.description: The cliff is located on top of Rand Mt in New Durham, NH. Cliff ranges from 30-70 feet. Boulders litter the surrounding area.
